headline: Grandma's Corn Chowder
description: Try grandma's corn chowder recipe for a creamy, delicious bowl of comforting soup made with creamed corn, potatoes, half-and-half, and bacon.

video.description: A rich, creamy chowder with bacon and potatoâ€”just like granny used to make.
video.name: Grandma's Corn Chowder

name: Grandma's Corn Chowder

recipeInstructions.text: Cook bacon in a large pot over medium-high heat until crisp, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain, leaving bacon and 2 tablespoons grease in the pot.

Add potatoes and onion to the pot; cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Add corn, water, salt, and pepper; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer, stirring frequently, until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Warm half-and-half in a small saucepan until it bubbles; remove from the heat just before it boils. Mix into chowder and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Loved it! I made it vegan by substituting 3 cups of normal frozen corn (pureed half before adding), fake bacon (Lightlife), and Silk soy creamer (original NOT vanilla, 2 cups) instead of the half&half.

Very tasty! Reminds me of the corn chowder I enjoyed as a child at my Nana's house. For the two of us, I halved all the ingredients. I replaced half the water I used with chicken stock, and added 3/4 cup of frozen corn. Thanks for an easy delicious lunch on a chilly day!
I followed the recipe (did add an extra potato) but will probably use only half the bacon grease next time. I also would like to try it with ham chunks instead of bacon.
Yummy corn chowder. Like my Maine family makes
My family loves this recipe with a few tweaks! I stew a chicken and use the broth in place of the water then pick the chicken and add it at the end, I also sautÃ© some mushrooms and add them!
I added a can of whole kernel corn and a can of shrimp to give it some zip.
This is one of my favorite recipes! It is very easy and delicious! Thank you for sharing it!

Iâ€™ve made this for years, but use two cans cream corn and one can whole kernel. I substitute whole milk for the water and half and half or light cream. Cook very slowly, donâ€™t let the milk boil, scrape the bottom and sides of the pan often to thicken the chowder naturally. The cooking process takes a lot longer than recommended here.
Add some roasted chicken for a heart meal soup.

Thank you Grandma! She knew the smoked bacon flavor and the caramelized potatoes and onions are perfect compliments to the corn. This also gets high marks for such a simple and quick meal. Only one way to improve on this is to use fresh corn cut and scraped off the cob, then fried in with the potatoes and onions, then add tbsp sugar at the end which is also in canned cream corn. FYI boiling the cobs gets great stock for this recipe and others! Obviously fresh corn and stock will change the quick and easy by doubling your time. Evaporated milk or a can of cream soup will substitute half and half if you donâ€™t have it on hand. I still say grandma knew how to keep it simple and delicious! Thanks for sharing this keeper recipe!!! ðŸ˜‹
It turned out really watery and bland. If I made it again, I would either thicken with corn starch or flour or skip all the water.

Simple a1nd delicious. 


I used chicken broth instead of water. Salted with nature's seasons and added cayenne pepper.


Wonder how it would be with heavy cream instead of half and half

It needs a lot more seasoning than just just salt and pepper. It was kind of bland until we added garlic powder. Other than that, I followed recipe exactly and it will definitely make it into our rotation because we love clam chowder.
This was pretty good. I thought one medium onion was a bit much so next time I will only use half, I also added celery salt to taste, and I think this really added to the flavor
I made this almost exactly to the recipe, just added a small can of regular corn with the creamed corn. Very very good! My husband couldn't stop raving about it.
It was very bland with too much liquid.

The corn chowder was very easy to make and very good. I made a few changes: I used fresh corn which I previously cooked, I also used 1 tsp of chicken bouillon in addition to some salt, and added som re fresh parsley. I omitted the bacon because I did not have any. I also decided to blend half of the chowder in the blender to give it a creamier texture.

I think this is a good recipe, but I also feel it is missing some flavor. I'm not sure if adding spices would help or if subbing chicken broth for the water. I'll use this as a base and modify it some for my family.
Very simple and easy. Tastes just like mom made it. Thanks for putting the recipe here
Super simple, easy to make and good at any time of the year.
Delicious! This is exactly the taste I was looking for. Perfect for a cold winter evening.
I reduced the onion to 1/2 onion and added 1/2 c. finely chopped celery, 1/2 c. finely chopped carrot and 2 more potatoes.
delicious! I kind of adjusted the ratios for what I had (also only cooking for one) and used chicken stock instead of water and used some water from the cans of corn.
Great stuff, will make again for sure.
Very good. I didnâ€™t have creamed corn - wanted to use some frozen garden corn - so I made a roux with the milk and added it at the end. Thanks for sharing your recipe!
I will make this again with a few tweaks...very yummy.

Perfection! My boyfriend loves corn chowder and he loves when I make this! I do it at least every 3 weeks (obviously not too often so he doesnâ€™t get tired of it)... my 2.5 year old also approves! Itâ€™s simple, fast and tastes sooooo good!
Made this adding fresh sweet Brentwood, Ca corn everything else was by the recipe and it was awesome! Will definitely make this again!
I made this soup exactly as the recipe said and it was delicious! My husband loved it so much he had it for lunch the next day! I will definitely be making this again!
The best corn chowder I've had. I spiced it up with Shrimp and hot sauce. Excellent.
My family loved this soup. Even Awesome Son #3, who dislikes corn. I did add a finely diced poblano pepper just because I was in the mood for it.

incredibly easy to make, simple ingredients, but simply fantastic. I did make a few changes/additions. I used chives and celery instead of onions. Also I added graded carrot for a some color about a 1/4 cup.
Loved it. Halved the recipe, used chicken broth instead of water and eyed the salt and pepper. I told my husband I am making this every week from now on.
i loved it
i loved it
I used veggie broth instead of water.

This was my first time making corn chowder and I followed the recipe exactly.
I was a little nervous but this turned out beautifully. So delicious! 
Will definitely be making it again... and again!

Says i made it one time made this recipie double batch at least six times. Its a huge hit with my teens! Its amazing. We love it! Thank you. For a family of five a double batch works perfect i give two cups each serving and usually my whole fam besides me had a second helping with about two servings left over. Have fun. Very easy.

This is my second review on this favorite. I added a fifth potato, it was one too many. My only other chance was low sodium chicken broth instead of water. Just wish my husband like it better. I make it, have some then give the rest away. My married kids like when I bring them some-a bonus supper.
so good. I made it a second time with some changes, but actually will go back to the way recipe is done with fewer changes.

It was delicious. My daughter doesn't eat onions so I substituted boiling onions. It was such a hit with everyone, which almost never happens. They all wanted more and there wasn't any left. Thank you!
So easy and delicious! I love when my family loves a new recipe. I might add an additional can of plain corn next time to add some depth and it's what my husband would like.
A huge hit at our office potluck!

It is a great base recipe. I had fresh corn from my garden so I used 3 cups of that along with one can of creamed corn. I prefer whole corn over creamed, and I used vegetable stock I had left over in place of water. I also added a small red bell pepper to give it a southwestern taste! I used a potato masher to 'cream' it, leaving it more lumpy and less creamy.
Amazing! Added a single stalk of chopped celery and one red chili pepper diced to give it some heat. Will definitely make again.
I love this recipe!!!!
Tasty even on the first day; used whole milk rather than half and half and didn't miss anything. Will make again!
Tasty even on the first day; used whole milk rather than half and half and didn't miss anything. Will make again!
Quick, easy, and yummy. My family will only eat bacon by itself not in anything, so I used salt pork instead. Also they like more potatoes and corn.
Added fresh chives it was amazing. My entire family said it was a hit!
Make mine with ham, 2 cans creamed and 1 can whole kernel corn. My kids donâ€™t like watery soups, so I add some potato flakes to thicken it up. Amazing on a cold winterâ€™s night!

This was pretty good. I like my chowder chunkier, so next time I plan to add more corn and potatoes. And probably slightly more seasoning, but a very good flavorful base for adjusting to your preferences.
LOVED IT & was a perfect 2 have a such a COLD DAY! Suoer stoked it came out amazing!
This was awesome. I did use chicken broth instead of water and 2 cans cream style corn and 1 whole kernel corn (untrained) and topped off the chowder with sharp cheddar cheese!!

This is one of the most simple soup recipe that has an abundance of flavor! One of my families favorites! I usually add more bacon and add back some of the drained off bacon grease while the bacon, onions and potatoes are cooking.
Excellent!!!
Thanks for the recipe!
Easy to put together and just what I wanted on a cold day. Only problem was my husband said, "I like creamed corn" Really?!
This soup is the best corn chowder Iâ€™ve tasted yet!
Great recipe. The only change I made was to use both cream style and whole cornel corn. Turned out great. Will definitely make it again.

There are some true idiots posting feedback. They change everything about the recipe and then give it a low rating. Maybe they shouldn't be allowed near a computer. That being said, this chowder was easy, full of flavor, and quick. I give it Five Well Deserved Stars!
My kids ate this up!

i kinda made it...used this as a base then: substituted turkey bacon because that's what my kids prefer, substituted frozen corn for canned, added a small ham steak, carrots, celery, chicken broth, shredded cheese, sage, thyme & garlic powder. i'd post a new recipe except that i cook by sight & taste & tend to not measure much. it was a huge hit with my boys, their friends & my parents...i made a lot but it didn't last long!

Great chowder for cold weather! I used 1 cup chicken broth and 1 cup water in place of the 2 cups of water. Also added ham and an additional 14oz can of regular corn. Soul food! Made alongside biscuits and a caesar salad... the perfect autumn dinner! Creamy, sweet, deliciousness!

This made a great recipe base for my corn chowder. I did make a few changes. Used chopped cooked chicken instead of bacon, used chicken broth instead of water, added garlic powder and a little celery. Will definitely be making this again!
I followed the directions exactly, but no one at my house liked this soup. It was very bland and starchy.
I used vegetable broth, water and half n half. Some season all along with salt and pepper. Delicious!!!
This was a very tasty chowder. I did substitute chicken broth for the water. Iâ€™m going to keep it in my recipe box!
Awesome chowder recipe! Altered a bit using chicken broth instead of water, as suggested by others, but I also added some Old Bay seasoning. It gave it just a little bit of something extra. Delish!!
Great flavor. Small changes: Vegetable stock instead of water, bay leaf or two. made creamed corn from this site instead of canned
Super easy and delicious! I doubled it and froze half before adding the half and half. Makes an easy work night meal. Thanks for sharing!
I made this as directed but with 2 cups vegetable broth instead of water. It was nothing special. Not think enough to be called chowder.
Good and easy
My family loves this chowder. I change it a bit depending on what I have on hand but the original recipe is great!

Creamy and delicious! I put a strip of roasted red pepper like it looks in the picture. A good touch! Kept the recipe.
Makes a lot so shared with family. I am trying to freeze some portions. Not sure of the outcome.
This is so delicious!
I cut down the cream to 1 cup and it was fine!
Very good recipe. All the family rated it a 5. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
The only change I made was add a little more salt. Wonderfully easy and delicious. Will definitely make again.

This was great! I followed the recipe and the suggestion to use chicken broth instead of water. The chicken broth adds another layer of flavor. This was my first time making corn chowder and I will be using this recipe to make it again. 
B. Round - Sav'h, GA

Okay, whatâ€™s with the lower ratings. This stuff is made by the hands of the Godâ€™s. Be thankful they left the recipe. Extremely good right out of the box as they say. I used Yukon golds, and a hint of chili powder, and a hint of my signature garnish.....a whiff of paprika for color only.
Sold real well at the pub. Killer chowder for all ages
My hubby and son loved it.

It was absolutely delicious. I followed the recipe exactly. It was so easy. Initially, as it was cooking and I was tasting to season, it appeared bland. It wasnâ€™t until it was finished that I remember the taste (generally in soups) develops as it settles. Once on the dinner table, it was scrumptious.
The only change I made was I used chicken stock . And I used 1 cup of half and half & 1 cup of heavy cream. It was so good, I couldn't quit eating it! Thank you for the recipe!

Family friendly & versatile....can easily add or subtract ingredients successfully. Great as written. I like to shred the potatoes & add a chopped green pepper & sometimes a can of chopped chicken. I use 4 cups chicken broth in place of water with the frozen corn, decrease the salt to about 1 tsp, precook the bacon & add it at the very end to keep it crispy. It doesn't need a thickener if the potatoes are shredded. Milk works just fine if you do not have half & half & I don't bother warming the milk before adding it. This is a family favorite!

I looked through many recipes for corn chowder and decided to go with this one based on the reviews. SO GLAD I DID!!! It truly was amazing!! I cooked an entire pound of bacon instead of the called for 1/4 cup, substituted chicken broth for water and added some shredded cheddar cheese. It was so good I made it a second time a week later and passed out a container to a few friends who also raved about it. I will def be making this again!
This is a delicious chowder. I didnâ€™t change a thing. Does anyone know if this can be frozen?

I made this last night for dinner and omg was it good! I added a bit more bacon than called for (I know I'm not the only one lol) And used chicken stock instead for water. My husband and I loved this, I will definitely be making this again next week! Plus it recipe could not get any easer, five stars!
So very good

Love it. Been making it for few years now and it's one of my family favorites. I throw one less can of cream corn and add a small bag of frozen corn. Sometimes I add a can of chicken broth. Always a hit

A hearty version of corn chowder! I added green onions at the end because I had some to use up and I served it with a cheddar soda bread (also on Allrecipes). I liked that I had the ingredients on hand and it was fairly quick to make, everything took about 45 minutes.

Us chicken broth instead of water, added celery. Used organic frozen sweet corn from BJs whole sale club. Itâ€™s amazing. Thickened with half corn starch half flour and chicken broth- mix in ninja or bullet . It was so good!

This was a big hit with my coworkers. Paired well with corn bread. I substituted chicken broth for water. I also added 1/2 cup of carrots, 1/2 cup of celery, 1 bay leaf and 1 tbsp cornstarch to thicken. I used 2 cans of cream style corn and 1 can of whole corn. I placed all of the ingredients in my slow cooker and cooked overnight.

This was an easy Chowder with excellent results. The second time I made it, used roasted potatoes That I seasoned before the Choweder the taste from those potatoes in addiction to the choweder was fabulous!

I made this last night. All 3 of my children loved it! This dish is definitely a keeper. Canâ€™t wait to make it for friends. I made it according to the recipe but I also added a 1/4tsp of cayenne pepper and subbed the water for bone broth. It surprised me as I didnâ€™t expect it to be as flavorful as it was.
Easy and delicious. Family loved it including my picky daughter.
We really liked it although did make some changes...added chicken, lima beans , and some extra veggies...we loved it!

This was very good and not overly creamy. Had it on a cold winter's night and it "hit the spot"..... not sure about the portion size though.... I cut the recipe in half for the two of us and hardly had enough for lunch the next day! We obviously enjoyed it! Made exactly as written.
